editionStmt.funder: Conversion of the printed catalogue to TEI funded by the Thompson Family Charitable Trust

msDesc.head: Sermons, mainly Geoffrey of St Thierry

msItem.incipit: Fuit homo missus a deo et cetera Iohannes iste cuius hodierne natiuitati catholica deuotius applaudit
msItem.explicit: uigor est uirium consummatio uirtutum bonis adquirens gloriam uirtutibus coronam
msItem.title: Unidentified.

msItem.rubric: De sanctis apostolis petro et paulo
msItem.incipit: Petrus apostolus et paulus Gloriosa nobis sollempnitas illuxit quam preclari martires martirum duces
msItem.explicit: iudicem nostrum qui singularis dominus et specialis est amicus ipsorum cui debetur honor et gloria
msItem.author: GEOFFREY OF ST THIERRY
msItem.title: sermo 14

msItem.incipit: Haurietis aquas in gaudio Adam in paradiso conditus est ubi erant delicie et fructus
msItem.explicit: fortitudo est posse penuriam pati uel quelibet aduersa propter iusticiam
msItem.note: Other copies appear at Worcester Cathedral MS Q20, fol. 20; South Bend, Ind., University of Notre Dame MS 9, fol. 40.

msItem.incipit: Habenti dabitur ei autem qui non habet │ [fol. 18v] Videndum est de temporalibus istis sicut et diuitiis et huiusmodi
msItem.explicit: felicitatis Adepturi in futuro ueritatem et cumulum superne iocunditatis
msItem.title: Unidentified.

msItem.incipit: Qvi uoluerit animam suam saluam facere perdet eam Quid hic uos dicitis obseruatores ciborum morum neglectores ypocritas et sequaces
msItem.explicit: placet de bibendo uino modico quod ille adiunxit non pretermittas
msItem.note: Another copy appears at St-Mihiel, BM, MS 31, fol. 130v.

msItem.incipit: Timuit helias iezabel Helias qui solaris uel fortis dominus interpretatur Hoc loco quemlibet conuersum
msItem.explicit: Et postea in corde meo non nostro quia singularis est gracia
msItem.author: GEOFFREY
msItem.title: sermo 49

msItem.rubric: De tribus fidelium generibus et tribus panibus
msItem.incipit: Tribus fidelium generibus qui sunt incipientes proficientes perfecti Tripartita trium panum debetur refeccio
msItem.explicit: pregustio future glorie que debetur ab eterno exquirentibus domini in ueritate
msItem.title: Unidentified.

msItem.incipit: Erat Naaman uir fortis Ecce parietem hystorie Folia uerborum proposuimus fodite parietem
msItem.explicit: uetustate primi hominis conformatur cristo de quo dicitur puer natus est nobis
msItem.title: Unidentified.

msItem.rubric: Item in xla. siue [later] in Rogationibus
msItem.incipit: Heliseus ad mortuum suscitaturus puerulum Attendant hystorie figuram nescientes excitentur scientes arguantur negligentes
msItem.explicit: os deum nominauit quod et uocatum est ab angelo priusquam in utero conciperetur
msItem.title: Unidentified.

msItem.incipit: Passurus in carne dei filius consilii secretioris altitudinern xijcim. suis commisit quos de milibus
msItem.explicit: argui et dampnari ad seculos corripi et liberari Ad tercios laudari et saluari
msItem.title: Unidentified.

msItem.incipit: Qvid tam purum quid ne tam solidum quam humilitas cordis Merito uero humilibus datur gratia
msItem.explicit: glorientur contumeliam gloriam reputantes obprobrium gaudium dispensationem exaltationem
msItem.title: Unidentified.

msItem.incipit: Redemptionem misit dominus populo suo Desiderate plurimum a pluribus et a diebus antiquis expectate diuinis
msItem.explicit: gratiam consequamur et auxilium in tempore oportuno adiuuante spiritu sancto
msItem.author: GEOFFREY
msItem.title: sermo 53

msItem.incipit: Locuturus uobiscum de regina celi domina mundi genitrice dei nostri tremore prorsus
msItem.explicit: preelecta et preparata altissimi filio qui es super omnia deus benedictus in secula amen
msItem.author: GEOFFREY
msItem.title: sermo 54

msItem.incipit: Fecit salomon thronum de ebore hinc itaque uide Non factum tale opus in uniuersis regnis
msItem.explicit: ad hunc tota affeccione suspiret ut eius gratiam inueniamus in tempore oportuno
msItem.author: GEOFFREY
msItem.title: sermo 55

msItem.incipit: Dies iste uere sollemnis multimoda refulget gaudiorum priuilegia quot portat et continet misteriorum celestium insignia Quatuor itaque sunt festiuis attollenda
msItem.explicit: regina Clemens gratie sue munera largiatur ihesus cristus filius tuus
msItem.author: GEOFFREY
msItem.title: sermo 56

msItem.incipit: Speciosus forma pre filiis hominum Glorificetur deus a nostra omnium paruitate qui in retroactis euitino festiuitatibus
msItem.explicit: uoce et opere ad salutem nostram et ad eius gloriam promerendam
msItem.title: Unidentified.

msItem.incipit: Induite uos armatura dei Milicia est fratres uita hominis super terram Quamdiu hic uiuimus
msItem.explicit: In his enim feliciter [marg.] consummatus superne ierusalem ciuis ascribi promeretur
msItem.author: GEOFFREY
msItem.title: sermo 56
msItem.note: Also appears as BARTHOLOMEW OF EXETER (Sharpe, no. 148 [69–70]), sermon 141, in BodL, MS Bodley 449, which is apparently Bartholomew’s own book; and, with an ascription to ALANUS DE ANGLIA, in BN, MS lat. 18172 (cf. Sharpe, nos. 73 and 77 [32, 33–4]).

msItem.incipit: de aptitudine solitudinis [later] Ibimus in uiam trium dierum etc. Tracta sunt uerba ista de contexione historiali quem legitur in exodo
msItem.explicit: ad hoc suadendum et utinam quod suadent deo miserante persuadeant [later]
msItem.author: GEOFFREY
msItem.title: sermo 48

msItem.rubric: De tribus sacrificiis que deus a nobis requirit
msItem.incipit: Introibo in domum tuam in holocaustis et cetera Ecce propheta qui erat intimus et concius secretorum dei sui
msItem.explicit: dicit propheta Vt uiderem uirtutem tuam et gloriam tuam Ad quam nos perducat et cetera
msItem.title: Unidentified.

msItem.rubric: De tribus que trahunt ad mortem et de tribus que deus ad salutem nostram in nobis et de nobis mirabili operatur
msItem.incipit: Erue nos in mirabilibus tuis domine deus noster Tria sunt que nos trahunt ad mortem superfluus amor nostri
msItem.explicit: quod legitur in apostolo Glorificate et portate deum in corpore nostro
msItem.title: Unidentified.

msItem.rubric: De. iiijor. que Jidelis anima debet creatori suo
msItem.incipit: Fidelis anima quatuor debet creatori suo timorem et reuerenciam fiduciam et amorem Nec tamen omnibus est dicere
msItem.explicit: que una rerum omnium summa est indissolubiliter faciat adherere
msItem.title: Unidentified.

msItem.rubric: In passione domini de iiijor. crucibus
msItem.incipit: Qvi uult uenire etc. Ecce fratres ecce illud dignissimum ecce istud salubre consilium
msItem.explicit: desideratis agni nuptiis reuerenter ad salutem animarum et corporum interesse
msItem.title: Unidentified.

msItem.incipit: Obsecro uos fratres per misericordiam dei Tria sunt fratres nostri que professores sacre religionis hominibus imitabiles
msItem.explicit: tenere que diximus Neglecta minantur mortem transgressoribus uitam adquirunt obsequentibus
msItem.note: Also appears in Hereford Cathedral, MS Piii.5, fols. 188v–90, another MS with a collection including material from GEOFFREY.

msItem.incipit: Dixit inimicus persequatur Uerba sunt antiqui serpentis que sapiunt uenenum peruersitatis diabolice
msItem.explicit: ad sublimitatem angelorum per ordinatas ascensiones homo reducitur et hec est perfeccio
msItem.title: Unidentified.

msItem.incipit: Qvamdiu hic sumus peregrinamur a domino Ecce quid dicit ecce quid plangit uas eleccionis doctor egregius moralis phiosophus
msItem.explicit: summa felicitas ad quam suspirat et utinam periungat nostre paruitatis humilitas
msItem.author: GEOFFREY
msItem.title: sermo 3

msItem.incipit: Gloria et honore c. e. d. Dies iste festiuus splendorem multimode pretendit alacritatis [corrected later] supersacratiore memoria et triumphali martiris
msItem.explicit: dum peregrinamur minuendo preces pro nobis fundant qui triumphant in celo
msItem.title: Unidentified.

msItem.incipit: In publica discussione futuri iudicii tria sunt ante iudicem proferenda in quibus potent esse clipeus
msItem.explicit: profiteri potent tolletur dampnandus cum impiis ne uideant gloriam dei
msItem.note: Sermo 84 in an anonymous collection, Brussels, Bibliotheque royale, MS 124 (Schneyer, 8:225).

msItem.incipit: Quatuor sunt dolores duos mali patiuntur in morte Primus dolor angustia corporalis
msItem.explicit: Nota preoccupauerunt me antequam de corpore exeat festinant ut deuorent

msItem.incipit: Series amabilis contextio dulces in qua fructus appetibilis quem proponit uniuersitati fidelium
msItem.explicit: que paucorum est a nobis exigit et acceptat plurimum dominus deus noster
msItem.author: GEOFFREY
msItem.title: sermo 39

msItem.incipit: Uenite et uidete opera domini et cetera Magna sunt et exquisita ualde uniuersa opera domini Magna inquam
msItem.explicit: quam depositum est preciosissimum ut ibi [marg.] cor habeant ubi est thesaurus eorvm
msItem.author: GEOFFREY
msItem.title: sermo 17
msItem.note: The remainder of the book is blank; fol. iv is bounded and ruled.

msItem.rubric: Sermo beati augustini episcopi In annuntiauione sancte Marie virginis
msItem.incipit: Thalamos marie et secreta coniugia quibus gabriel paranimphus interfuit
msItem.explicit: in sponsalibus tante uirginis et tante matris non exultant insuper et insultant
msItem.author: PS.-AUGUSTINE
msItem.title: Sermon
msItem.note: ed. PL suppl. 4:1993–5. Fol. 1 has a table of contents for the subsequent sermons, not including this added one. Fols. 1–3 are an added quire, 14 (–1).

supportDesc.extent:
Fols. iii + 121 (numbered 1–119, iv, v) + iv (numbered fols. vi–ix). 230 165
155–60 110

collation.formula: [Fols. 4–119, iv, v] 1–68 78 (–6 apparently a cancel with no text loss) 8–148 158 (–8, blank).
collation.catchwords: Catchwords towards the gutter at the ends of quires 8–14;
collation.signatures: quires 1–3, 5–7 signed on the last verso with a roman numeral, I–VII.

layoutDesc.layout: Written in long lines, 25 lines to the page. Prickings rare; bounded and ruled in brown crayon.

handDesc.handNote: Written in protogothic bookhand, above top line. Punctuation by point, punctus elevatus, punctus interrogativus, and occasional punctus versus.

decoDesc.decoNote: Three-line blue lombards with red flourishing (for the first text, a 3-line capital in red, unflourished).
Red-slashed capitals to divide the texts.
Running titles indicating the homily number, to ‘xxvi.’ on fol. 105. The correction mark ‘cor’ centred at the foot of each page.

binding.p: Modern rebinding. Sewn on five thongs. At the front, a marbled paper leaf and two paper flyleaves; at the rear, one medieval vellum flyleaf (probably a former pastedown), two modern paper flyleaves, and another marbled paper leaf (vi–ix).

history.provenance: ‘Hic liber est ecclesie beati Thome martiris de liesnes [i.e. Lessness] Quem qui ei abstulerit aut illi super eo fraudem fecerit nisi eidem ecclesie plene satisfecerit anathema sit Maranatha fiat fiat amen’ (fol. 2, upper margin; ‘Lienus’ also in the margin, fol. 65) (Ker, MLGB 114).
Four quotations, from Aristotle, Bonaventura, Gregory (Moralia 5), and Augustine (fol. v; mixed anglicana/secretary s. xv ex.).
Pen-trials (fols. vv and vi, s. xv).
history.acquisition: ‘Liber Collegii Sanctj Iohannis Baptistae Oxon’ ex dono venerabiis virj Rich Tileslye Sacrae Theologiae Doctoris Ecclesiae Cathedralis Roffensis Archidiaconj ejusdemque Collegii olim socij’ (fol. 1v).

source.bibl: Ralph Hanna, A descriptive catalogue of the western medieval manuscripts of St. John's College, Oxford (Oxford: Oxford University Press, 2002)

availability.p: For enquiries relating to this manuscript please contact St John's College Library.

listBibl.bibl: Hamman, A.-G., Patrologiae cursus completus a J. P. Migne editus, Series Latina, Supplementum, 5 vols. (Paris: Garnier Frères, 1958-1974; Caenegen, 1978: 207-209), vol. 4.

Ker, N. R., Medieval Libraries of Great Britain: A List of Surviving Books. Royal Historical Society Guides and Handbooks. 2nd edn. (London, 1964), extended by Andrew G. Watson, MLGB: Supplement to the Second Edition. RHS Guides and Handbooks 15 (1987).
Schneyer, Johannes Baptist, Repertorium der lateinischen Sermones des Mittelalters für die Zeit von 1150-1350, 11 vols. (Münster i. W., 1969-90).
Sharpe, Richard, A Handlist of the Latin Writers of Great Britain and Ireland before 1540. Publications of the Journal of Medieval Latin 1 (Turnhout, 1997).
